meanings.definition: Direct or guide (something) into a different channel or course.
meanings.sent1: She rechannelled the water flow to the garden hose.
meanings.sent2: The traffic was rechannelled to avoid the construction zone.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel rechannelled the bird feeder to its own stash.
meanings.sent4: Her determination rechannelled her life towards success.
meanings.sent5: The engineer rechannelled the power supply with precision.

meanings.definition: Redirect or change the direction or course of (something).
meanings.sent1: He rechannelled the conversation away from the sensitive topic.
meanings.sent2: The storm rechannelled the river, altering its path.
meanings.sent3: The magician rechannelled the audience's attention to his next trick.
meanings.sent4: The new manager rechannelled the team's focus towards productivity.
meanings.sent5: The wind rechannelled the sand, creating mesmerizing patterns.
